page.title: 13GAS
page.content:
Most houses have calor gas stoves and additional heating units.
SEWAGE AND WASTE DISPOSAL
There is no mains sewage. Each new house that is built must have a septic tank to treat the sewage before discharging it into the sea. All combustible household waste is burnt. Waste metal and glass are dumped at a chosen spot on the coastline and are hopefully washed away to the depths or quickly rust away. A great deal of waste from passing ships is washed up on the shore. Wood is collected for the fires, and some useful items are kept for possible future use, but the majority of the waste is an unsightly nuisance.
